titlestmt.titleproper: Grand Rapids, MI. South Congregational Church records, 1850-2001.
titlestmt.author: William McCarthy

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday November 30, 2021 at 15:36

did.unittitle: Grand Rapids, MI. South Congregational Church records, 1850-2001.
did.abstract: The origins of South Congregational Church start in 1874 when women from the Park Avenue Congregational Church organized a Sunday School. This would eventually lead to a "Mr. Gilbert" donating land for construction of a chapel. The new chapel was located between Sheldon and Jefferson on Delaware Street and finished in 1876. The South Congregational Church was officially organized on December 12, 1878 with 43 charter members. The church would see steady growth until the end of the 1900s, when membership began to decline and financial resources became stretched. The community decided to close in 2001 and held its final service on September 9th. This collection contains church records such as vital statistics and meeting minutes, historical records such as anniversaries and newspaper articles, financial records such as account books and mortgages, organizational records for groups like the Ladies Aid Society and Missionary Society, and pastoral records like sermons and correspondences.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Grand Rapids, MI. South Congregational Church records, 1850-2001, RG4657. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library by Virginia Child in September 2001; 2001-04.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by William McCarthy, September 2021, using DACS second edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The origins of South Congregational Church start in 1874 when women from the Park Avenue Congregational Church organized a Sunday School. This would eventually lead to a "Mr. Gilbert" donating land for construction of a chapel. The new chapel was located between Sheldon and Jefferson on Delaware Street and finished in 1876. The South Congregational Church was officially organized on December 12, 1878 with 43 charter members. The group was accepted into the Grand River Conference the following year. Also in 1879, the minister Rev. Sarjent oversaw the expansion of the building due to growth of membership. The building was moved in 1886 to the cordner of Delaware and Sheldon, accompanied by additional expansion. Four separate ministers took the pulpit in the 1890s including Rev. Frederick York in 1896. The following year, the church suffered a fire which nearly destroyed everything. Funds were raised to not only repair but expand as the membership had seen continual growth.

Multiple ministers would take over during the early 1900s with the longest tenured being Rev. Charles Grieshaber who served from 1909-1926. The church was hit by a fire again, this time during building repairs in 1936. When Rev. Earl Collins took over in 1941, he oversaw another large increase in membership. This increase led the community to seek a new home in the growing south part of the city. The church moved to the corner of Madison and Alger and included a social hall, offices and classrooms. At this time, the number of people in the Sunday School was nearly 800. The church would continue at this new location with numerous other pastors until a tornado struck on April 21, 1967. A building fund was launched shortly after and a brand new Sanctuary was dedicated two years later in February 1969. The church mortgage was completely paid off in 1970. At this time, the church was still fully committed to education, having around 450 students.

The church membership began to decline and financial resources became stretched. The community decided to close in 2001 and held its final service on September 9th. At the final dedication, the church noted all the different ways they would provide resources after disbanding. This included selling the building to the New Covenant Life Ministries, while donating other items to Remember, Burton Heights Elementary School, and to the Interfaith Hospitality Network. Proceeds of the sale were given to the Pilgrim Manor Foundation, United Church Outreach Ministries, Habitat for Humanity, and finally a trust given to the Michigan Conference UCC for a Southside Grand Rapids New Church Start.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains church records such as vital statistics and meeting minutes, historical records such as anniversaries and newspaper articles, financial records such as account books and mortgages, organizational records for groups like the Ladies Aid Society and Missionary Society, and pastoral records like sermons and correspondences.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been arranged into five series and four sub-series. The records in each series has been arranged chronologically by start date except in the meetings and reports sub-series.

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The collection contains VHS tapes and a reel which the library does not have the equipment to properly play.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: 1. Historian's reports and sketches, in the Grand Rapids, MI. South Congregational Church records, 1850-2001, RG4657. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.
2. Closing service of worship, in the Grand Rapids, MI. South Congregational Church records, 1850-2001, RG4657. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains church records from the South Congregational Church and includes vital statistics, meeting minutes, various church reports, newsletters and visual materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the vital statistics from the South Congregational Church and includes membership lists, transfers, dismissals, marriages, baptisms, directories and a membership survey.

did.unittitle: Jesse Fry's handbook of records (1 of 2)
Jesse Fry's handbook of records (2 of 2)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains meetings and reports related to the South Congregational Church. This includes the Board of Trustees, Annual reports, meeting minutes, Church council meeting minutes, and yearbook reports.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged chronologically by group, with one-offs at the end.

did.unittitle: Board of Trustees notes and correspondences
Board and committee reports and notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains newsletters produced by the South Congregational Church and includes the South Church Messenger, The Fountain Pen, South Church Page, and The Messenger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains visual materials from the church and includes photos, VHS tapes of church events and a rededication service on a reel.

did.unittitle: Planting the Seeds of our Faith (copy 1)
Planting the Seeds of our Faith (copy 2)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains historical records related to the church and includes anniversaries, pamphlets, newspaper articles, order of services and constitutions.

did.unittitle: Does it play to support the gospel here?

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains financial records from the church and includes account books, indentures, building records, mortgages, treasurer's reports, non-profit paperwork, deeds and information on selling property.

did.unittitle: Proposal plans for the enlargement and improvement of First Congregational Church
Construction and dedication of new sanctuary
New Life Covenant Ministries tenant records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the pastors of the church and includes reports, messages, correspondences, sermons, and installations.

did.unittitle: Condolence on death of Rev. Earl Collins
Installation of Rev. Philip E. Reikow
Installation of Rev. Ronald C. Skidmore
Installation of Rev. Dr. Virginia H. Child

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the various organizations of South Congregational Church and includes the Home society, Missionary society, Ladies Aid Society, Women's Fellowship, service team, nomination committee, Top of the Hill club, Diaconate, and Vision team.

did.unittitle: Rules and By-laws of the Women's Fellowship
Top of the Hill club records
